  getTransaction(transactionID: "1234567890") {
    id
    amount
    rate
    timestamp

query concurrentRequests($walletIDs: [ID!]!) {
  wallets(ids: $walletIDs) {
    id
    name
    balance
  }
}

mutation concurrentMutations($walletIDs: [ID!]!, $balance: Float!) {
  updateBalance(wallets: { ids: $walletIDs, balance: $balance }) {
    id
    balance
  }
}

mutation updateWalletBalance($walletID: ID!, $newBalance: Float!) {
  updateBalance(wallets: { id: $walletID, balance: $newBalance }) {
    id
    balance
  }
}

mutation triggerAccountUpdate($walletID: ID!) {
  triggerAccountUpdate(wallets: { id: $walletID }) {
    id
    balance
  }
}

    walletID: "d7f1da86-c5bd-4d61-9374-832bc4ecc7c8"

      amount
      currency
    }
  }

    amount
    rate
    timestamp
  }

    timestamp

------------------Payload:-------------------

query {
  currencies(
    where: { country: "USA" },
    orderBy: { abbreviation: desc }
  ) {
    id
    abbreviation
    symbol
    rate
    country
  }
  currency(id: 1) {
    id
    abbreviation
    symbol
    rate
    country
  }
  user(username: "johnDoe") {
    id
    username
    email
  }
}

        firstName
        lastName
      }
    }

  getWallets(offset: 0, limit: 100) @batchSize(50) {

# Query 1: Fetching multiple wallets with heavy filtering and sorting
query {
  wallets(
    filter: { name: { contains: "test" }, balance: { gt: 10 } },
    sort: { id: DESC }
  ) {
    id
    name
    balance
  }
}

# Query 2: Retrieving wallet history with large date range
query {
  getWalletHistory(
    walletID: "wal1",
    startDate: "2020-01-01",
    endDate: "2022-12-31"
  ) {
    timestamp
    amount
  }
}

# Query 3: Fetching multiple transactions for a single wallet
query {
  getTransactions(walletID: "wal1", limit: 100) {
    id
    amount
    timestamp
  }
}

------------------Payload:-------------------

# Query 4: Performing bulk updates on multiple wallets
mutation {
  updateWallets(
    updates: [
      { walletID: "wal1", balance: 50.0 },
      { walletID: "wal2", name: "New Name" }
    ]
  ) {
    id
    name
    balance
  }
}

# Query 5: Creating and deleting multiple wallets in a single query
mutation {
  createWallets(
    wallets: [
      { name: "New Wallet 1", balance: 20.0 },
      { name: "New Wallet 2", balance: 30.0 }
    ]
  ) {
    id
    name
    balance
  }
  deleteWallets(walletIDs: ["wal3", "wal4"]) {
    id
    name
    balance
  }
}

# Query 6: Simulating a high-traffic scenario with repeated queries
query {
  getWallet(walletID: "wal1") {
    id
    name
    balance
  }
}
query {
  getWallet(walletID: "wal2") {
    id
    name
    balance
  }
}

------------------Payload:-------------------

# Query 7: Fetching multiple wallets with caching enabled
query ($cacheControl: String!) {
  getWallets(
    cacheControl: $cacheControl,
    filter: { name: { contains: "test" }, balance: { gt: 10 } },
    sort: { id: DESC }
  ) {
    id
    name
    balance
  }
}

# Query 8: Retrieving wallet history with caching enabled and large date range
query ($cacheControl: String!) {
  getWalletHistory(
    cacheControl: $cacheControl,
    walletID: "wal1",
    startDate: "2020-01-01",
    endDate: "2022-12-31"
  ) {
    timestamp
    amount
  }
}

  updateUser(
    description: "John Doe"
    firstName: "Jane Doe"

      { id: "12345", name: "Wallet 1" },

        id: "67890",
        name: "Wallet 2",

          abbreviation: "USD",
